{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-20T17:59:58.000Z", "description": "Position: Site Reliability Engineer
Location: Remote
Job Type: 12 Months

Job Responsibilities:
\u2022\tWork in a cross-functional team to design and implement the next generation of CI/CD
\u2022\tplatform as a service in-house product.
\u2022\tLeverage Kubernetes operators, Tekton and Spinnaker pipelines to automate the
\u2022\tdeployment and administration of applications across multiple environments on-prem
\u2022\tand in the cloud.
\u2022\tDefine workflows and processes to meet Infrastructure-as-Code objectives.
\u2022\tActively facilitate continuous improvement.
\u2022\tMonitor various systems capacity and health indicators and trends.
\u2022\tProvide 24x7 tier-3 troubleshooting and break-fix support for production services.
\u2022\tDesign and build RESTful microservices enabling the application of role-based access
\u2022\tcontrol, network policies, and service registration.

Required Qualifications:
\u2022\t2-5 years of relevant work experience.
\u2022\tStrong software engineering skills, preferably working in multiple programming
\u2022\tlanguages (Java, Go, Python).
\u2022\tProficiency in cloud-native technologies and architectures (Docker, Kubernetes,
\u2022\tOpenShift).
\u2022\tProficiency in revision control and DevOps best practices (Git).
\u2022\tExpert Linux experience (Red Hat, CentOS).

Preferred Qualifications:
\u2022\tExperience with public or private cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud,
\u2022\tOpenStack).
\u2022\tFamiliarity with continuous integration/deployment tools and platforms (Spinnaker,
\u2022\tDrone, Jenkins, Ansible).
\u2022\tFamiliarity with Application Performance Monitoring (APM or tracing)
\u2022\tContributions to open-source projects.

Regards,
Justeen
Technical Recruiter
VDart Inc
Email: Justeen.d@vdartinc.com
